chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua S Hadlock was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with Agent.
Work out payment plan with Agent.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system.
Defendant shall not operate a vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood, unless authorized by healthcare provider.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Report to jail today to serve 48 hours.  Court will stay remaining portion of sentence for 60 days.
Defendant may serve in Adams, Columbia, Sauk or Waupaca County jail.
**Amended 8/10/15 to indicate the defendant is entitled to good time.

40 hours for each year of probation.
Defendant to provide verified documentation to the Agent.
